page.title: 14B.B.C. Training Cont.
page.content: By about 1940 Wood Norton was producing about 835 hours of broadcasting,making it one of the biggest broadcasting centres in Europe During the war many famous people broadcasted from Wood Norton (too many to list). On the 4th of September 1940 Wood Norton was struck by a great fire and because of a drought water had to be taken from the river.Not long after the fire was put out a temporary roof was put on and things got back to normal. After the war Wood Norton became a training establishment and now has all of the equipment needed.
